intro: Aetheilema micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowering heads. Aetheilema micranthum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
